Based on your preference for Saul Dibb's work and a twisty, engaging narrative, I'd recommend "White Night". This thriller is directed by Saul Dibb and follows an unsolved murder case that spans over fifteen years, with a haunting sense of responsibility driving the lead investigator to reopen the case.

For something more lighthearted but still directed by Saul Dibb, you might enjoy "Hitch", a film that recounts one of the most famous encounters in cinema history between Alfred Hitchcock and François Truffaut. It's an interesting exploration of two legendary directors discussing their craft.
